name: AWS Bedrock Guardrail
description: Integrate AWS Bedrock Guardrails to enhance the safety of AI APIs. AWS Bedrock Guardrails offer configurable protections designed to help developers build generative AI applications responsibly and at scale. This policy mediates both request and response content by validating it through the AWS Bedrock Guardrails service, and enforces the serviceâ€™s decision to allow, block, or mask content accordingly.

policyAttributes.name: name
policyAttributes.description: The name of the guardrail policy. This will be used for tracking purposes.

policyAttributes.name: region
policyAttributes.description: The deployed region of the guardrail resource.

policyAttributes.name: guardrailId
policyAttributes.description: The ID of the guardrail resource.

policyAttributes.name: guardrailVersion
policyAttributes.description: The version of the guardrail resource.

policyAttributes.name: jsonPath
policyAttributes.description: Specify the JSONPath expression that identifies the location where prompt decoration should be applied.

policyAttributes.name: redactPII
policyAttributes.description: When enabled, detected PIIs are redacted and will not be restored to its original form. This should be enabled when the policy is attached to the response flow to prevent exposing AI-generated content with sensitive data to the client. When disabled and applied to the request flow, detected PII is temporarily masked and automatically restored in the corresponding response.

policyAttributes.name: passthroughOnError
policyAttributes.description: If enabled, the request or response is passed through without validation when the Azure Content Safety service is unavailable. Otherwise, a guardrail validation error is triggered.

policyAttributes.name: showAssessment
policyAttributes.description: When enabled, the error response will include detailed information about the reason for the guardrail intervention.
